com.io7m.jcanephora.core

Class JCGLViewMatrices

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.io7m.jcanephora.core.JCGLViewMatrices

  • public final class JCGLViewMatrices
extends Object
    Functions to produce view matrices.

    • Method Detail

      • lookAtRH

        public static com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.matrices.Matrix4x4D lookAtRH(com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.vectors.Vector3D camera,
                                                                                  com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.vectors.Vector3D target,
                                                                                  com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.vectors.Vector3D up)

        Calculate a view matrix representing a camera looking from the point camera to the point target. target must represent the "up" vector for the camera. Usually, this is simply a unit vector (0, 1, 0) representing the Y axis.

        The function assumes a right-handed coordinate system.

        Parameters:
        camera - The position of the viewer.
        target - The target being viewed.
        up - The up vector.
        Returns:
        The view matrix

      • lookAtRHP

        public static <A,B> com.io7m.jtensors.core.parameterized.matrices.PMatrix4x4D<A,B> lookAtRHP(com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.vectors.Vector3D camera,
                                                                                             com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.vectors.Vector3D target,
                                                                                             com.io7m.jtensors.core.unparameterized.vectors.Vector3D up)

        Calculate a view matrix representing a camera looking from the point camera to the point target. target must represent the "up" vector for the camera. Usually, this is simply a unit vector (0, 1, 0) representing the Y axis.

        The function assumes a right-handed coordinate system.

        Type Parameters:
        A - A phantom type parameter, possibly representing a source coordinate system
        B - A phantom type parameter, possibly representing a target coordinate system
        Parameters:
        camera - The position of the viewer.
        target - The target being viewed.
        up - The up vector.
        Returns:
        The view matrix
